disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Sunday 8 May to end of Monday 9 May GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Dry and warm with variable cloud and sunny spells expected.<br/><br/>The winds should become more northerly, but still with Atlantic origins so bringing little imported pollution. Air movement is also expected to be sufficient for adequate dispersal of local emissions.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Tuesday 10 May to end of Tuesday 10 May GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Cloudy with intermittent light rain and some sunshine on Tuesday.<br/><br/>A south-westerly 'clean' Atlantic breeze is forecast. Good dispersion of any local emissions expected.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>
